headline: Kraft Heinz names former Kellogg CEO to helm Chicago packaged food giant ahead of planned split next year
summary: Kraft Heinz has named veteran Chicago-based executive Steve Cahillane as CEO beginning Jan. 1, taking the reins of the packaged food giant as it prepares to split into two companies. Cahillane most recently served as chairman and CEO of Kellanova, the Chicago-based snack foods spinoff from cereal-maker Kellogg, which was acquired by Mars in a $36 billion deal that closed last week. The ...

headline: Kraft Heinz gets a new CEO ahead of company split: Can Steve Cahillane turn around the ailing food giant?
summary: The former head of Kellanova is taking the helm after years of declining sales and slow growth, with shares down 75% since 2017.

headline: Kraft Heinz taps former Kellogg chief as its CEO as it prepares to split into 2 companies
summary: The former CEO of the Kellogg Co. has been tapped to lead Kraft Heinz as it prepares to split into two companies.  Kraft Heinz said Tuesday that Steve Cahillane will serve as CEO starting Jan. 1.  Once Kraft Heinz becomes two companies – which is expected to happen in the second half of next year – Cahillane will become the CEO of what is currently called Global Taste Elevation Co. That company will house some of Kraft Heinz’s biggest sellers, including Kraft Mac & Cheese, Philadelphia cream cheese and Heinz.

headline: The Kraft Heinz Company Names Steve Cahillane Chief Executive Officer
summary: PITTSBURGH & CHICAGO, December 16, 2025--The Kraft Heinz Company (Nasdaq: KHC) ("Kraft Heinz" or the "Company") today announced that it has named Steve Cahillane as Chief Executive Officer of the Company, effective January 1, 2026. He will also join the Company’s Board of Directors and serve as CEO of Global Taste Elevation Co. following Kraft Heinz’s planned separation into two independent, publicly traded companies. Carlos Abrams-Rivera will step down January 1 and serve as an advisor to the C

headline: Has Kraft Heinz’s 2025 Share Slump Created a Long Term Value Opportunity?
summary: Wondering if Kraft Heinz is quietly turning into a value opportunity, or if the market is correctly pricing in long term challenges? This breakdown will give you a clear, no-nonsense view of where things stand. The stock has slipped 20.4% year to date and is down 16.9% over the last year. It has inched up 1.1% in the last week, a combination that often signals shifting expectations around both growth and risk. Recently, the spotlight has been on Kraft Heinz as it leans harder into cost...
